channel.title: Recursion on Hashnopolis
channel.description: Recent content in Recursion on Hashnopolis

item.title: Decode Ways
item.description: A message containing letters from A-Z is being encoded to numbers using the following mapping: ‘A’ -> 1 ‘B’ -> 2 … ‘Z’ -> 26 Given a non-empty string containing only digits, determine the total number of ways to decode it. Example 1: Input: "12" Output: 2 Explanation: It could be decoded as "AB" (1 2) or "L" (12). Example 2: Input: "226" Output: 3 Explanation: It could be decoded as "BZ" (2 26), "VF" (22 6), or "BBF" (2 2 6).
